snippet: Are they Bostonians or New Yorkers? Cherished chairs from colonial days go on display at the Bernard & S. Dean Levy gallery in New York, but their history is anything but clear.
abstract: Eve M Kahn Antiques column; 18th-century walnut chairs go on display at Bernard & S Dean Levy gallery; artworks by Ruth Asawa will be sold at Los Angeles Modern Auctions and Keno Auctions; exhibit of sculptures by Anna Hyatt Huntington will open at Columbia University's Wallach Art Gallery.
lead_paragraph: Are they Bostonians or New Yorkers? Cherished chairs from colonial days go on display at the Bernard & S. Dean Levy gallery in New York, but their history is anything but clear.

headline.main: Disputing the Origins of Four-Legged Treasures
headline.print_headline: Settle Down, Gently, and Join the Debate
